Business Information: Since 1996, our firm has served as a fierce advocate for the rights and interests of our clients. Due to our experience, skill and record of success, our peers recognize the legal team at Marsh, Rickard & Bryan as a force in and out of the courtroom.

Matt Abbott with the Abbott Law Firm proudly represents the legal needs of those with with personal injury and wrongful death claims. From his law office in Birmingham, Alabama, Abbott focuses on the areas of tractor-trailer and automobile collisions, defective product liability and medical/pharmaceutical negligence. Abbott serves clients who need representation for worker's compensation as well as those who have fallen victim to consumer fraud and insurance bad faith. Abbott strives to protect those who are the victim of civil rights violations and wrongful government indictment. Abbott also represents "whistle-blowers" who come forward to expose fraud and corruption against the United States government through the False Claims Act.

Since 1967, Forstman & Cutchen, LLP has been here to fight for your rights in auto and truck accident cases. Don't let a negligent driver bring you down. Well aggressively pursue the compensation you deserve for lost wages, medical expenses and suffering. Well attempt to negotiate a settlement with the insurance company, but we are also prepared to go to court when needed. You will pay no fee unless we win. Call to schedule a free consultation.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

The law firm of Arthur Edge III, P.C., is a team of experienced attorneys and staff dedicated to providing the best possible legal services to each of its clients. At Arthur Edge III, P.C., every effort is made to effectively and efficiently manage each case, and to provide timely resolution for clients. The firm's offices are conveniently located in downtown Birmingham on historic Morris Avenue. The firm is a civil litigation firm with an emphasis on construction defect litigation. In addition to construction defect claims, the firm handles a wide variety of civil matters including claims for wrongful death, personal injury, tractor-trailer accidents, motor vehicle accidents, workersâ€™ compensation claims, insurance claims, products liability, consumer fraud claims and claims against companies providing termite protection services.The firmâ€™s extensive knowledge of construction law is founded upon many years of experience and success litigating all forms of construction issues. The attorneys and staff at Arthur Edge III, P.C., strive to maintain the knowledge and experience essential to successfully address the ever changing complexities unique to construction defect litigation. We have obtained judgments and settlements for home owners in claims made against builders, developers, excavators, architects, engineers, manufacturers of defective building products, distributors of defective building products and real estate agents in Alabama, Georgia, Tennessee, Mississippi, New Jersey, and Texas in both state and federal court. We have successfully resolved hundreds of cases for our clients during the last fifteen years.You may conveniently find us located on the Web at:     ArtEdgePC.com.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Business Name: Porterfield Harper Mills Motlow & Ireland PA

Massey, Stotser & Nichols was initially created in 1977. Timothy A. Massey founded the firm in 1977, and he and Garrick L. Stotser formed Massey & Stotser in 1990. Welcome to Heninger Garrison Davis law firm. We are so glad you found us. Whether you are experiencing a business dispute or have suffered a life-altering injury, our attorneys are here to help you navigate the legal system from start to finish. From consumer class action to personal injury cases, Heninger Garrison Davis was founded on the belief that representing a plaintiff levels the playing field so that one person can stand toe to toe with the largest corporations.

In operation since 2000, Christian & Small is a full-service law firm. It offers a range of counseling and litigation services. Christian & Small provides legal services to clients in matters that involve trademark infringement, unfair competition, dilution and the misappropriation of trade secrets. In addition, Christian & Small offers advisory services for operating, independent contractor, joint venture and buy-sell agreements, as well as employment contracts.

Cases and projects are staffed with the goal of achieving success for the client with maximum efficiency. With offices in Athens, Birmingham, Mobile, and Baldwin County, Ala., and in Jackson, Miss., Hand Arendall are uniquely situated among the Southeast's major law firms to provide legal direction to clients throughout Alabama and Mississippi.

Business Name: The Law Office of Thomas Johnson Moore
Business Information:
I’m passionate about standing up for people who have been injured by others. For more than 20 years, I have helped people secure the financial recovery they need to not only recover from tragic circumstances, but also invest in a brighter future. 
 
Personal, one-on-one service is at the core of my practice. I take the time to listen to clients’ stories and understand the full picture of what they are going through. I only take on a limited number of cases so that I can give each client the attention they deserve.

Schedule Your Free Consultation With Our Personal Injury Lawyers 
 
We are dedicated to recovering damages for the people we serve, including individuals, consumers, small businesses, and railroaders who have suffered harm because of the negligent or wanton conduct of others. Our attorneys draw on over 50 years of combined experience to pursue civil litigation including personal injury claims, class actions and mass torts. We fight tirelessly to maximize financial compensation for our clients and assert their legal rights.

Since 2005, our dedicated personal injury attorney at Kies Law LLC has been advocating for injured individuals in Birmingham, Alabama and beyond. If you were hurt due to the negligence of another person or entity, schedule a free initial consultation with us today to start seeking compensation. We skillfully handle car accident, slip and fall, truck accident, motorcycle accident, and wrongful death cases throughout Alabama.

We are a family law firm who can answer your questions, check out on your claim, so you get the best possible help. With beyond 40 years of experience, we know how to win in the fight for injury victims in Alabama and throughout the country. Those who are injured, abused, cheated or have a loved one who suffered a wrongful death can come to us for legal help so they can get the best possible results from an investigation of their claim. The Norris law office has the go-to prosecutors for injury victims to assist them in their declaration of what is rightfully theirs. When an injury happens, it is necessary to act immediately because there are deadlines to file an injury claim. It is vital to get started right away since procrastination would risk your rights to compensation. Take immediate action. Call us at the Norris law office as our team is available round the clock.

Street Address: 10 Old Mont201 Vulcan Rd, Birmingham, AL 35209gomery Hwy Ste 250

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

In operation since 2000, Christian & Small is a full-service law firm. It offers a range of counseling and litigation services. Christian & Small provides legal services to clients in matters that involve trademark infringement, unfair competition, dilution and the misappropriation of trade secrets. It defends individuals and businesses in criminal investigation matters. The firm also defends transportation companies in personal injury, employment, and cargo and property damage cases. In addition, Christian & Small offers advisory services for operating, independent contractor, joint venture and buy-sell agreements, as well as employment contracts.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

I’m passionate about standing up for people who have been injured by others. For more than 20 years, I have helped people secure the financial recovery they need to not only recover from tragic circumstances, but also invest in a brighter future. 
 
Personal, one-on-one service is at the core of my practice. I take the time to listen to clients’ stories and understand the full picture of what they are going through. I only take on a limited number of cases so that I can give each client the attention they deserve.

Schedule Your Free Consultation With Our Personal Injury Lawyers 
 
We are dedicated to recovering damages for the people we serve, including individuals, consumers, small businesses, and railroaders who have suffered harm because of the negligent or wanton conduct of others. Our attorneys draw on over 50 years of combined experience to pursue civil litigation including personal injury claims, class actions and mass torts. We fight tirelessly to maximize financial compensation for our clients and assert their legal rights.

Since 2005, our dedicated personal injury attorney at Kies Law LLC has been advocating for injured individuals in Birmingham, Alabama and beyond. If you were hurt due to the negligence of another person or entity, schedule a free initial consultation with us today to start seeking compensation. We skillfully handle car accident, slip and fall, truck accident, motorcycle accident, and wrongful death cases throughout Alabama.

We are a family law firm who can answer your questions, check out on your claim, so you get the best possible help. With beyond 40 years of experience, we know how to win in the fight for injury victims in Alabama and throughout the country. Those who are injured, abused, cheated or have a loved one who suffered a wrongful death can come to us for legal help so they can get the best possible results from an investigation of their claim. The Norris law office has the go-to prosecutors for injury victims to assist them in their declaration of what is rightfully theirs. When an injury happens, it is necessary to act immediately because there are deadlines to file an injury claim. It is vital to get started right away since procrastination would risk your rights to compensation. Take immediate action. Call us at the Norris law office as our team is available round the clock.

Starnes Davis Florie LLP was founded in 1975 and devoted its practice to litigation. The firm has more than 50 attorneys and still specializes in civil litigation practice. Starnes Davis Florie represents physicians, attorneys, architects, accountants, corporations, insurances and multiple other professionals. Its main office is in Birmingham, Ala., and also has a presence in Mobile, Ala. Starnes Davis Florie handles litigation matters throughout the entire state. The law firm recruits law students through a summer program and interviews potential recruits at statewide universities and colleges.

Established in 1975, Starnes Davis Florie LLP provides legal services. Located in Birmingham, Ala., the firm is one of the leading firms in Alabama. Its areas of practice are alternative dispute resolution, appellate, written advocacy, aviation, banking, financial services and biotechnology/pharmaceutical cases. It is involved in handling of insurance coverage opinions, insurance coverage disputes and declaratory judgment actions, among others. Starnes Davis Florie LLP clients list includes corporations, hospitals, banks/municipalities to doctors, attorneys, architects and accountants.

Matt Abbott with the Abbott Law Firm proudly represents the legal needs of those with with personal injury and wrongful death claims. From his law office in Birmingham, Alabama, Abbott focuses on the areas of tractor-trailer and automobile collisions, defective product liability and medical/pharmaceutical negligence. Abbott serves clients who need representation for worker's compensation as well as those who have fallen victim to consumer fraud and insurance bad faith. Abbott strives to protect those who are the victim of civil rights violations and wrongful government indictment. Abbott also represents "whistle-blowers" who come forward to expose fraud and corruption against the United States government through the False Claims Act.

Since 1967, Forstman & Cutchen, LLP has been here to fight for your rights in auto and truck accident cases. Don't let a negligent driver bring you down. Well aggressively pursue the compensation you deserve for lost wages, medical expenses and suffering. Well attempt to negotiate a settlement with the insurance company, but we are also prepared to go to court when needed. You will pay no fee unless we win. Call to schedule a free consultation.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Street Address: 10 Old Mont201 Vulcan Rd, Birmingham, AL 35209gomery Hwy Ste 250

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Mark DiCello and Adam Levitt co-founded DiCello Levitt LLC with the mission of achieving justice in all its dimensions. The firm represents businesses, individuals, and public clients injured by the wrongs of others. DiCello Levitt works tirelessly to secure a more just and equitable future for its clients. And with more than $18 billion in recoveries since 2017, DiCello Levitt is off to a great start. 
 
For the most part, DiCello Levitt restricts its practice to the representation of plaintiffs, most of which need help with complex litigation matters. Because DiCello Levitt hires talented lawyers who share the firm’s values and offer a breadth of experience and expertise, DiCello Levitt is regularly a first choice for clients looking for top-flight legal representation in class action, mass tort, public client, whistleblower/qui tam, cybersecurity, complex commercial, securities, and financial services litigation, to name just a few of our practice areas. Our “trial first” philosophy, respected courtroom acumen, and unyielding dedication sets industry standards, advances the law, and results in larger settlements and verdicts than in other similar cases. 
 
Standing idly by is not an option for DiCello Levitt. Every day, in every way, we’re working to provide a fairer and safer world. That’s why, in just a few years’ time, we’ve expanded from 11 lawyers in two offices to more than 40 lawyers in seven offices nationwide. We go wherever in the world we need to go for our clients, and we innovate to achieve historic results. When we see opportunities to make a larger, more meaningful impact, we strategize and do just that.   
 
We also recognize that the cause of justice starts at home. With a less hierarchical approach to law firm management, DiCello Levitt fosters trust and communication within the firm that benefits our team and our clients. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are essential elements of a thriving community, and we actively recruit women, minority, and LGBTQ lawyers who demonstrate acumen and responsibility, regardless of their seniority. 
 
DiCello Levitt focuses on more than just achieving “best in class” results for our clients. One of our goals is for our cases to change human and corporate behavior so that we’re all safer in the future. Another is to influence society and the law to ensure a more responsible and dignified justice system. Since 2017, DiCello Levitt has advanced the law to provide enhanced cybersecurity, product safety, civil rights and human rights protections, and governmental transparency. When you work with DiCello Levitt, you’re not only protecting your own rights and future, but you’re also meaningfully contributing to a safer, fairer world.

She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Mark DiCello and Adam Levitt co-founded DiCello Levitt LLC with the mission of achieving justice in all its dimensions. The firm represents businesses, individuals, and public clients injured by the wrongs of others. DiCello Levitt works tirelessly to secure a more just and equitable future for its clients. And with more than $18 billion in recoveries since 2017, DiCello Levitt is off to a great start. 
 
For the most part, DiCello Levitt restricts its practice to the representation of plaintiffs, most of which need help with complex litigation matters. Because DiCello Levitt hires talented lawyers who share the firm’s values and offer a breadth of experience and expertise, DiCello Levitt is regularly a first choice for clients looking for top-flight legal representation in class action, mass tort, public client, whistleblower/qui tam, cybersecurity, complex commercial, securities, and financial services litigation, to name just a few of our practice areas. Our “trial first” philosophy, respected courtroom acumen, and unyielding dedication sets industry standards, advances the law, and results in larger settlements and verdicts than in other similar cases. 
 
Standing idly by is not an option for DiCello Levitt. Every day, in every way, we’re working to provide a fairer and safer world. That’s why, in just a few years’ time, we’ve expanded from 11 lawyers in two offices to more than 40 lawyers in seven offices nationwide. We go wherever in the world we need to go for our clients, and we innovate to achieve historic results. When we see opportunities to make a larger, more meaningful impact, we strategize and do just that.   
 
We also recognize that the cause of justice starts at home. With a less hierarchical approach to law firm management, DiCello Levitt fosters trust and communication within the firm that benefits our team and our clients. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are essential elements of a thriving community, and we actively recruit women, minority, and LGBTQ lawyers who demonstrate acumen and responsibility, regardless of their seniority. 
 
DiCello Levitt focuses on more than just achieving “best in class” results for our clients. One of our goals is for our cases to change human and corporate behavior so that we’re all safer in the future. Another is to influence society and the law to ensure a more responsible and dignified justice system. Since 2017, DiCello Levitt has advanced the law to provide enhanced cybersecurity, product safety, civil rights and human rights protections, and governmental transparency. When you work with DiCello Levitt, you’re not only protecting your own rights and future, but you’re also meaningfully contributing to a safer, fairer world.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Mark DiCello and Adam Levitt co-founded DiCello Levitt LLC with the mission of achieving justice in all its dimensions. The firm represents businesses, individuals, and public clients injured by the wrongs of others. DiCello Levitt works tirelessly to secure a more just and equitable future for its clients. And with more than $18 billion in recoveries since 2017, DiCello Levitt is off to a great start. 
 
For the most part, DiCello Levitt restricts its practice to the representation of plaintiffs, most of which need help with complex litigation matters. Because DiCello Levitt hires talented lawyers who share the firm’s values and offer a breadth of experience and expertise, DiCello Levitt is regularly a first choice for clients looking for top-flight legal representation in class action, mass tort, public client, whistleblower/qui tam, cybersecurity, complex commercial, securities, and financial services litigation, to name just a few of our practice areas. Our “trial first” philosophy, respected courtroom acumen, and unyielding dedication sets industry standards, advances the law, and results in larger settlements and verdicts than in other similar cases. 
 
Standing idly by is not an option for DiCello Levitt. Every day, in every way, we’re working to provide a fairer and safer world. That’s why, in just a few years’ time, we’ve expanded from 11 lawyers in two offices to more than 40 lawyers in seven offices nationwide. We go wherever in the world we need to go for our clients, and we innovate to achieve historic results. When we see opportunities to make a larger, more meaningful impact, we strategize and do just that.   
 
We also recognize that the cause of justice starts at home. With a less hierarchical approach to law firm management, DiCello Levitt fosters trust and communication within the firm that benefits our team and our clients. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are essential elements of a thriving community, and we actively recruit women, minority, and LGBTQ lawyers who demonstrate acumen and responsibility, regardless of their seniority. 
 
DiCello Levitt focuses on more than just achieving “best in class” results for our clients. One of our goals is for our cases to change human and corporate behavior so that we’re all safer in the future. Another is to influence society and the law to ensure a more responsible and dignified justice system. Since 2017, DiCello Levitt has advanced the law to provide enhanced cybersecurity, product safety, civil rights and human rights protections, and governmental transparency. When you work with DiCello Levitt, you’re not only protecting your own rights and future, but you’re also meaningfully contributing to a safer, fairer world.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Our “trial first” philosophy, respected courtroom acumen, and unyielding dedication sets industry standards, advances the law, and results in larger settlements and verdicts than in other similar cases. 
 
Standing idly by is not an option for DiCello Levitt. Every day, in every way, we’re working to provide a fairer and safer world. That’s why, in just a few years’ time, we’ve expanded from 11 lawyers in two offices to more than 40 lawyers in seven offices nationwide. We go wherever in the world we need to go for our clients, and we innovate to achieve historic results. When we see opportunities to make a larger, more meaningful impact, we strategize and do just that.   
 
We also recognize that the cause of justice starts at home. With a less hierarchical approach to law firm management, DiCello Levitt fosters trust and communication within the firm that benefits our team and our clients. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are essential elements of a thriving community, and we actively recruit women, minority, and LGBTQ lawyers who demonstrate acumen and responsibility, regardless of their seniority. 
 
DiCello Levitt focuses on more than just achieving “best in class” results for our clients. One of our goals is for our cases to change human and corporate behavior so that we’re all safer in the future. Another is to influence society and the law to ensure a more responsible and dignified justice system. Since 2017, DiCello Levitt has advanced the law to provide enhanced cybersecurity, product safety, civil rights and human rights protections, and governmental transparency. When you work with DiCello Levitt, you’re not only protecting your own rights and future, but you’re also meaningfully contributing to a safer, fairer world.

Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Mark DiCello and Adam Levitt co-founded DiCello Levitt LLC with the mission of achieving justice in all its dimensions. The firm represents businesses, individuals, and public clients injured by the wrongs of others. DiCello Levitt works tirelessly to secure a more just and equitable future for its clients. And with more than $18 billion in recoveries since 2017, DiCello Levitt is off to a great start. 
 
For the most part, DiCello Levitt restricts its practice to the representation of plaintiffs, most of which need help with complex litigation matters. Because DiCello Levitt hires talented lawyers who share the firm’s values and offer a breadth of experience and expertise, DiCello Levitt is regularly a first choice for clients looking for top-flight legal representation in class action, mass tort, public client, whistleblower/qui tam, cybersecurity, complex commercial, securities, and financial services litigation, to name just a few of our practice areas. Our “trial first” philosophy, respected courtroom acumen, and unyielding dedication sets industry standards, advances the law, and results in larger settlements and verdicts than in other similar cases. 
 
Standing idly by is not an option for DiCello Levitt. Every day, in every way, we’re working to provide a fairer and safer world. That’s why, in just a few years’ time, we’ve expanded from 11 lawyers in two offices to more than 40 lawyers in seven offices nationwide. We go wherever in the world we need to go for our clients, and we innovate to achieve historic results. When we see opportunities to make a larger, more meaningful impact, we strategize and do just that.   
 
We also recognize that the cause of justice starts at home. With a less hierarchical approach to law firm management, DiCello Levitt fosters trust and communication within the firm that benefits our team and our clients. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are essential elements of a thriving community, and we actively recruit women, minority, and LGBTQ lawyers who demonstrate acumen and responsibility, regardless of their seniority. 
 
DiCello Levitt focuses on more than just achieving “best in class” results for our clients. One of our goals is for our cases to change human and corporate behavior so that we’re all safer in the future. Another is to influence society and the law to ensure a more responsible and dignified justice system. Since 2017, DiCello Levitt has advanced the law to provide enhanced cybersecurity, product safety, civil rights and human rights protections, and governmental transparency. When you work with DiCello Levitt, you’re not only protecting your own rights and future, but you’re also meaningfully contributing to a safer, fairer world.

Alabama Personal Injury LawyerOur goal at Morris Haynes is to represent the victims of wrongdoing and injury in their claims against the powerful corporations of the world, with an absolute commitment to the highest principles of professionalism and advocacy. Were dedicated to serving you however we can, and doing whats best for you in your personal injury case.If you or someone you love has been injured as the result of the negligence of someone else, you may be entitled to compensation. Call Morris Haynes. Common causes of personal injury lawsuits are: Car AccidentsCar accidents are extremely common, and anything from a fender bender to a serious highway accident can cause personal injury. Even without medical expenses, these kinds of accidents can lead to serious vehicle damage and repair costs. If you were harmed in a car accident due to the negligence of someone else, you deserve to be compensated for your injuries. The attorneys at Morris Haynes have extensive experience in these kinds of cases, and will do whatever we can to help you.Truck AccidentsIts easy for an accident involving an 18-wheeler to get complicatedand fast. When a truck is owned by a company, there are a lot of legal questions that need answering if you want to get the compensation you deserve. Luckily, our attorneys are no strangers to these kinds of accidents. Well help you gather, and sort through, all the evidence you need to make a successful case and maximize your recovery.Motorcycle AccidentsAccording to the U.S. Department of Transportation motorcyclists are 35 times more likely to experience a deadly accident on the road than those in passenger cars. Due to the weight difference between motorcycles and other vehicles, these accidents almost always result in injuries with extensive medical bills.Boating Accidents2019 was the deadliest year on Alabama waters since 1998, with 25 boating deaths. That number surpasses year-end totals for the last 20 years. Boating accidents are a serious threat to the safety and wellbeing of Alabamas residents, and you need expert legal help to recover what you deserve. The primary cause of boating accidents is operator error.Product LiabilityWhen a product doesnt work the way its meant to, especially if it causes harm to those who put their trust in it, someone needs to be held responsible. Our track record regarding product defect cases has earned our firm the respect of many opposing attorneys and a reputation for providing excellent representation. We have over 30 years of experience as a law firm helping clients receive compensation from some of the most powerful corporations in the country. If you or a loved one have been injured as a result of a defective product contact us.Gun DefectsMost people expect their guns to protect them, or at least to allow them to participate in a hobby they love. When a gun is defective, it can lead to very serious injuries and even death. Gun manufacturers have a responsibility to check each and every brand, make, and model they produce for quality assurance. When they slip up, it has serious consequences. If youve been harmed, or a loved one was killed, by a defective gun, the attorneys at Morris Haynes are ready to fight for you.Slip and Fall AccidentsSlip and fall accidents can result in serious injuries. All property owners are expected to keep their properties clean and safe for the people who use them. When they dont, personal injuries are bound to happen. Whether you or a loved one tripped over something left in a pathway, or slipped on a slick floor with no warning, well fight to get you the compensation you deserve.

Business Information: The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Mark DiCello and Adam Levitt co-founded DiCello Levitt LLC with the mission of achieving justice in all its dimensions. The firm represents businesses, individuals, and public clients injured by the wrongs of others. DiCello Levitt works tirelessly to secure a more just and equitable future for its clients. And with more than $18 billion in recoveries since 2017, DiCello Levitt is off to a great start. 
 
For the most part, DiCello Levitt restricts its practice to the representation of plaintiffs, most of which need help with complex litigation matters. Because DiCello Levitt hires talented lawyers who share the firm’s values and offer a breadth of experience and expertise, DiCello Levitt is regularly a first choice for clients looking for top-flight legal representation in class action, mass tort, public client, whistleblower/qui tam, cybersecurity, complex commercial, securities, and financial services litigation, to name just a few of our practice areas. Our “trial first” philosophy, respected courtroom acumen, and unyielding dedication sets industry standards, advances the law, and results in larger settlements and verdicts than in other similar cases. 
 
Standing idly by is not an option for DiCello Levitt. Every day, in every way, we’re working to provide a fairer and safer world. That’s why, in just a few years’ time, we’ve expanded from 11 lawyers in two offices to more than 40 lawyers in seven offices nationwide. We go wherever in the world we need to go for our clients, and we innovate to achieve historic results. When we see opportunities to make a larger, more meaningful impact, we strategize and do just that.   
 
We also recognize that the cause of justice starts at home. With a less hierarchical approach to law firm management, DiCello Levitt fosters trust and communication within the firm that benefits our team and our clients. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are essential elements of a thriving community, and we actively recruit women, minority, and LGBTQ lawyers who demonstrate acumen and responsibility, regardless of their seniority. 
 
DiCello Levitt focuses on more than just achieving “best in class” results for our clients. One of our goals is for our cases to change human and corporate behavior so that we’re all safer in the future. Another is to influence society and the law to ensure a more responsible and dignified justice system. Since 2017, DiCello Levitt has advanced the law to provide enhanced cybersecurity, product safety, civil rights and human rights protections, and governmental transparency. When you work with DiCello Levitt, you’re not only protecting your own rights and future, but you’re also meaningfully contributing to a safer, fairer world.
